channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 The New York Times Company

item.title: In Israel, Kerry Sees ‘Work to Do’ to Get Deal on Cease-Fire
item.description: Secretary of State John Kerry sought to forge a truce in the Gaza Strip a day after American civilian flights to Israel were suspended.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and JODI RUDOREN

item.title: In a Grim Game of Numbers, Israel and Palestinians Vie for Advantage
item.description: The war’s tally of death and destruction is used by both sides to bid for international sympathy, part of the daily blur of developments as the Gaza conflict rages on.
item.dc:creator: By JODI RUDOREN
item.media:description: Israeli soldiers carried the coffin of Sgt. Max Steinberg during his funeral in Jerusalem on Wednesday.

item.title: Letter From India: Mukesh Ambani’s Reliance Industries Runs Into Trouble
item.description: Though Mukesh Ambani’s Reliance Industries is richer than ever, a penalty for failing to meet natural gas production levels has roiled the waters.
item.dc:creator: By MANU JOSEPH

item.title: TransAsia Airways Plane Crashes Off Taiwan, Killing Dozens
item.description: The twin turbprop crashed while attempting an emergency landing as Typhoon Matmo brought heavy winds and rain to the region.
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Sheng Ching, the director of Taiwan's Civil Aeronautics Administration, addressed reporters at the Sungshan airport in Taipei on Wednesday.

item.title: Raqqa Journal: In a Syrian City, ISIS Puts Its Vision Into Practice
item.description: Islamist extremists in control of Raqqa have blended their fundamentalist interpretation of Islam with the practicalities of governance.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By an EMPLOYEE of THE NEW YORK TIMES and BEN HUBBARD
item.media:description: To those entering Raqqa Province, home to about a million people, ISIS makes clear, immediately, who is in charge.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Giant Yellow Toad Shrinks Online After Resemblance to Leader Is Noted
item.description: The censorship began after someone photoshopped a pair of large, square eyeglasses on the toad and pointed out just how much it looked like Jiang Zemin, the former Chinese president.
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Visitors to Yuyuantan Park in Beijing riding boats near the giant inflatable toad created by the Chinese artist Guo Yongyao.

item.title: A Blast, a Fire and an Israeli Soldier Goes Missing
item.description: Israeli officials said they were uncertain whether the soldier had been captured by Palestinian forces in Gaza or killed in combat.
item.dc:creator: By ISABEL KERSHNER and JODI RUDOREN
item.media:description: Sgt. Oron Shaul of the Israeli Army.

item.title: Plane Crashes in Taiwan, 47 Trapped, Feared Dead
item.description: A plane landing in stormy weather crashed outside an airport on a small Taiwanese island late Wednesday, and a transport minister said 47 people were trapped and feared dead.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: U.N. Official Cites ‘Strong Possibility’ of War Crimes in Gaza Conflict
item.description: Navi Pillay, the high commissioner for human rights, pointed the finger at military actions by both Israel and Hamas.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE

item.title: Greenpeace Says China’s Energy Plans Exacerbate Climate Change
item.description: Two operational coal-to-gas plants in China and 48 proposed ones would together emit an estimated 1.1 billion tons of carbon dioxide per year, Greenpeace said.
item.dc:creator: By EDWARD WONG

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: 5 Detained in China Over Processing of Spoiled Meat
item.description: Two members of the management of Shanghai Husi Food were among those held after workers were found using expired meat to make products for fast-food restaurants.
item.dc:creator: By NEIL GOUGH
item.media:description: Workers gathered at a workshop of Shanghai Husi Food, a meat supplier for McDonald's and KFC.

item.title: Ukraine Says 2 Fighter Jets Are Shot Down as Clashes Intensify
item.description: The planes were reported shot down as the first bodies from the Malaysia Airlines crash in eastern Ukraine were returned to the Netherlands.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ANDREW HIGGINS

item.title: Ex-General to Challenge Results in Indonesia Election
item.description: Prabowo Subianto, declared the loser in the Indonesian presidential vote, will appeal to the Constitutional Court, claiming widespread irregularities, his campaign said.
item.dc:creator: By JOE COCHRANE

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: Turkey Can Teach Israel How to End Terror
item.description: Turkey faced a terrorist threat for decades and has now made peace. Israel should follow its example.
item.dc:creator: By MUSTAFA AKYOL

item.title: Costa Concordia Begins Journey to Italian Port
item.description: The ill-fated cruise ship was recently lifted to the surface, two and a half years after it ran aground in an accident that killed 32 people.
item.dc:creator: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Town in Northwest China Sealed After Man Dies of Plague
item.description: The police in Yumen, Gansu Province, closed the city on Tuesday as a precaution after health officials said a man had died of pneumonic plague after having come in contact with a Himalayan marmot.
item.category: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
item.dc:creator: By NEIL GOUGH

item.title: They Did This? In Rebel Country, Disbelief
item.description: In eastern Ukraine, many residents may side with the pro-Russian rebels, but they don’t see the fighters as capable of having taken down the Malaysia Airlines plane with a missile.
item.dc:creator: By SABRINA TAVERNISE
item.media:description: After visiting the crash site of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 in Grabovo, Ukraine, women took shelter from the rain.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Film Has Crowds Swarming to Beijing House, Haunted or Not
item.description: Chaonei No. 81, arguably Beijing’s most celebrated “haunted house,” had already seen a steady stream of visitors over the years.
item.dc:creator: By AMY QIN
item.media:credit: Gilles Sabrie for The New York Times
item.media:description: The house is reputed to harbor the ghost of the mistress of a Kuomintang official who hanged herself in 1949.

item.title: World Briefing: China: Plague Isolates Parts of City
item.description: China has sealed off parts of its northwestern city of Yumen after a resident died of bubonic plague last week, the state news media reported on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: Nigeria: President Meets With Parents of Schoolgirls Captured by Militants
item.description: President Goodluck Jonathan on Tuesday met for the first time with the parents of several hundred schoolgirls kidnapped from the town of Chibok and dozens of classmates who escaped their militant captors.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Thailand: Temporary Charter Adopted
item.description: Thailand adopted a temporary Constitution on Tuesday, taking its first step toward the return of electoral democracy after two months of military rule.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: U.N. Warns of Polio Risk in War Zones
item.description: The United Nations expressed concern about the possible spread of polio in the war-ravaged countries of Syria and Iraq and beyond on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: World Briefing: Turkey: Officers Arrested in Spy Case
item.description: Dozens of Turkish police officers were detained on Tuesday and accused of spying on Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan and his top aides.
item.category: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
item.dc:creator: By SEBNEM ARSU

item.title: Memo From Guadalajara: Promises of Hope Tarnished by Lack of Change
item.description: Even as the president garners international praise for pushing through reforms in energy, education and taxes, voters are less willing to embrace platitudes without true transparency.
item.dc:creator: By DAMIEN CAVE
item.media:description: A masked protester wearing a revolutionary costume in Mexico City had signs mocking the governing party. One sign says “Peña Nieto PRIvatizes Education.”

item.title: Report Cites ‘Aggressive’ Islamic Push in British City’s Schools
item.description: A report suggests that some concerns raised about an Islamic takeover of British schools in a letter widely deemed as fake could be real.
item.dc:creator: By KATRIN BENNHOLD
item.media:credit: Maja Daniels for The New York Times
item.media:description: Park View Academy has been at the heart of the Operation Trojan Horse inquiry.
